DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine the effects of CLP, with and without spironolactone, on serum, urine, and fecal contents in heart failure patients with chronic kidney disease.
DOC.brief_title: Evaluation of CLP With and Without Spironolactone in Heart Failure Patients With Chronic Kidney Disease
DOC.criteria: Heart failure with New York Heart Association (NYHA) Classification II or III Chronic kidney disease Cardiac ejection fraction <40% On heart failure therapy including an ACEI or ARB, and a BB Willing to understand and comply with study procedures and provide written informed consent. Hospitalization within 4 weeks of baseline visit History or presence of gastrointestinal conditions such as severe constipation or gastrointestinal tract strictures Current or anticipated dialysis during study In the investigator's judgment, any cardiovascular, renal, hepatic, endocrine, gastrointestinal, neurological, or other disease or condition that makes the subject's study participation unsafe Drug or alcohol abuse
